description.narrative: Schools have capacities and skills to provide access to quality, inclusive education and support learning outcomes and life skill acquisition within a safe, participatory and child friendly environment., which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Sanitation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: School-aged girls and boys, especially early adolescents (aged 10-14) [in targeted districts], acquire essential learning outcomes and practice skills for life, are safe from exploitation, harmful practices and violence, and benefit from integrated social services (including in emergencies).

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF EDUCATION SCIENCE AND TECHNOLOGY

sector.narrative: Ending violence against women and girls
Prevention of undernutrition in adolescence (10 to 19 years)
Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of training of school communities e.g. parent teacher associations, school management committees
Provision or procurement of primary education learning materials
Sanitation and hygiene - institutions (schools, health care facilities, ECD centres) including menstrual hygiene management
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
System strengthening - risk informed programming, including climate, resilience, disaster, conflict, and emergency preparedness
Water supply and sanitation - large systems

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Schools have capacities and skills to provide access to quality, inclusive education and support learning outcomes and life skill acquisition within a safe, participatory and child friendly environment.
